title.rendered: Tucson Rodeo 2023: How to watch La Fiesta De Los Vaqueros online

content.rendered:
Tucson Rodeo is back for 2023! The 98th Annual Tucson’s La Fiesta De Los Vaqueros Rodeo will be held on Saturday, February 18th – Sunday, February 26th, 2023 in Tucson, AZ. The first La Fiesta de los Vaqueros (Celebration of the Cowboys) in 1925 touted 3 days of events and competition. Today, the event has grown to a 9 day celebration centered on the Tucson Rodeo, one of the top 25 professional rodeos in North America. Here’s a simple guide to watch Tucson Rodeo 2023 live stream, channel TV info.

La Fiesta De Los Vaqueros
Venue Tucson Rodeo Grounds, Tucson, AZ
Date Feb 18 – 26, 2023
Sanction PRCA, WPRA
Purse $180,000
Broadcast The Cowboy Channel, CowboyChannelPlus

What TV Channel will the La Fiesta De Los Vaqueros 2023 be on?

The entirety of the Tucson’s La Fiesta De Los Vaqueros Rodeo main performances will air live on the The Cowboy Channel, Cowboy Channel + from Feb 18-26, 2023. portal-alpha.financial-ombudsman.org.uk has rounded up everything you need to know about how to watch the Tucson’s La Fiesta De Los Vaqueros Rodeo on TV and online.

How to watch Tucson Rodeo 2023?

Western Lifestyle Network is pleased to share with an individual the latest and finest in rodeo news in addition to events, up next will be the highly-anticipated Tucson Rodeo 2023! The Tucson Rodeo will be televised Feb 18-26, 2023 and performances live on The Cowboy Channel and Cowboy Channel +. The Cowboy Channel now available on Dish Network-232, Direct TV-603, Cox-260 anytime, and anywhere.

The Cowboy Channel:

  1. AT&T (Channel 566)
  2. Charter Spectrum
  3. Comcast
  4. Suddenlink
  5. Sling TV’s Heartland Package
  6. Verizon FiOS TV

To find out if RFD-TV and THE COWBOY CHANNEL are available in your area, please click here and enter your zip code also choose your Pay TV provider.

Cowboy Channel +

Stream The Cowboy Channel programming live, watch past episodes of your favorite shows, and follow all the latest rodeo action. The Cowboy Channel Plus is available for only $9.99 a month or save up to 25% and purchase the whole year for $89.99. To sign up for the PRCA on The Cowboy Channel Plus app, visit www.cowboychannelplus.com.

Supported Device

  • Web: Any web-connected desktop, laptop, tablet, or mobile phone using the latest version of Chrome (recommended), Firefox, Safari, Edge, or Internet Explorer.
  • Mobile App: If you have an iPhone or iPad, search for “Cowboy Channel +” in the App Store.
  • TV: If you have an Apple TV (4th generation) or Roku, search for “Cowboy Channel +” in the App Store or in the Roku Channel Store.

La Fiesta De Los Vaqueros Schedule

Saturday February 18th

  • Opening Day! Gates Open 11am. Rodeo 12pm ProRodeo Competition, Coors Barn Dance 21 years old and older only. *Access with purchase of a rodeo ticket plus $5 per person.

Sunday February 19th

  • Pink Day! wear pink to support breast cancer initiatives. Visit the Chicksnchapsaz.org 8 a.m. Chicks n Chaps Women’s Rodeo Clinic 11 a.m. – gates open NOON – Coors Barn Dance to follow 21 & over.

Thursday February 23rd

  • Parade day 9:00 am. Tucson Rodeo third performance. Gates open 11am. Rodeo NOON -Coors Barn Dance to follow 21 years and older only.

Friday February 24th

  • FOURTH PERFORMANCE Gates open 11am Rodeo NOON. Coors Barn Dance to follow 21 years and older only.

Saturday February 25th

  • FIFTH PERFORMANCE Gates open 11am. Rodeo NOON Coors Barn Dance to follow 21 years and older only.

Sunday February 26th FINALS

  • FINAL PERFORMANCE Gates open 11am. Rodeo NOON Coors Barn Dance to follow 21 years and older only.

La Fiesta De Los Vaqueros Events

  • Bareback Riding
  • Bull Riding
  • Saddle Bronc Riding
  • Steer Wrestling
  • Team Roping
  • Tie Down Roping
  • Women’s Barrel Racing

Where does the Tucson rodeo take place?

The Tucson Rodeo Grounds
The Tucson Rodeo Grounds is a 36-acre facility which is the home of La Fiesta de los Vaqueros Tucson Rodeo and the Tucson Rodeo Parade and Museum.

Who competes in the Tucson Rodeo?

The Tucson Rodeo is a professional rodeo which invites contestants from the United States and Canada! This is one of the first major events on the PRCA schedule!

How long does the Tucson rodeo last?

The Tucson Rodeo enlists contestants from the United States and Canada for the nine-day celebration, which is known for “non-stop action with bull riding, bareback and saddle bronc riding, steer wrestling, and barrel racing.”

How much are Tucson Rodeo tickets?

Tucson Rodeo tickets for the event at Tucson Rodeo Grounds, 4823 S. 6th Ave, Tucson, AZ are on sale now and it will take place on February 26th, 2023 at 12:00pm. 314 tickets are currently available for the event on TicketSmarter’s app and website with prices in the range of $37.00 to $85.00.

What time is the rodeo parade in Tucson?

This colorful, exciting Parade is presented each year and keeps the spirit of the first Parade back in 1925. Now known to be the largest Non-Motorized Parade in the country, It still achieves its success through the community’s participation and the dedicated work of its volunteer members. The Parade begins at 9 am.

For additional information visit:

  • Rodeo Tickets: https://www.tucsonrodeo.com/
  • Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association: https://www.prorodeo.com/
  • Beutler & Son Rodeo Co: https://beutlerandsonrodeo.com/
  • Women’s Professional Rodeo Association: http://www.wpra.com/
